util.py¶

This module contains general helping utilities.

src.util.print_dict(d: Mapping[any, any]) → None¶

Print the specified dictionary to the standard output.

Example:

>>> print_dict({'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': {'d': 3}})
>>> 'a': 1
>>> 'b': 2
>>> 'c': {'d': 3}
src.util.read_sorted(path: str) → Iterable[str]¶

Return the lines of the file at path in ascending alphabetical order.

Example:

We have a file.txt with the following content:

c
b
a

Sort-reading it produces:

>>> read_sorted('file.txt')
>>> ['a', 'b', 'c']
src.util.sort_neighborhoods(cities: Mapping[str, dict[str, dict[str, str] | Iterable[str]]]) → Mapping[str, dict[str, dict[str, str] | Iterable[str]]]¶

Sort the provided cities’ neighborhoods in alphabetical ascending order.
